article:
Events and trends
* 756 BCâFounding of Cyzicus.
* 755 BCâAshur-nirari V succeeds Ashur-Dan III as king of Assyria
* 755 BCâAeschylus, King of Athens, dies after a reign of 23 years and is
  succeeded by Alcmaeon.
* 753 BCâAlcmaeon, King of Athens, dies after a reign of 2 years. He is replaced
  by Harops, elected Archon for a ten-year term.

* 753 BCâThe city of Rome and the Roman Kingdom is founded, according to Roman
  tradition, and is ruled by Rome's first king, Romulus. Beginning of the Roman
  'Ab urbe condita' calendar. Rome adopts the Etruscan alphabet, which the
  Etruscans themselves had adopted from the Greeks. Set by Varro, this was the
  most common date used.
* 752 BCâRomulus, first king of Rome, celebrates the first Roman triumph after
  his victory over the Caeninenses, following the Rape of the Sabine Women. He
  celebrates a further triumph later in the year over the Antemnates.
* c. 750 BCâMan and Centaur, perhaps from Olympia, is made. It is now at The
  Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.
* c. 750 BCâAge of colonisation begins. WHERE? Specifics needed.
* c. 750 BCâGreeks establish colonies in Italy and Sicily.
* c. 750 BCâFirst tyrants take their seats. WHERE? Specifics needed.
* c. 750 BC â 700 BCâFunerary Vase (Krater), from the Dipylon Cemetery, Athens,
  is made. Attributed to the Hirschfield workshop. It is now at The Metropolitan
  Museum of Art, New York.

Significant people
* Shoshenq V, Pharaoh of the Twenty-second dynasty of Egypt (767â730 BC)
* Osorkon III, Pharaoh of the Twenty-second dynasty of Egypt (787â759 BC)
* Takelot III, Pharaoh of the Twenty-third dynasty of Egypt (764â757 BC)
* Rudamun, Pharaoh of the Twenty-third dynasty of Egypt (757â754 BC)
* Iuput, Pharaoh of the Twenty-third dynasty of Egypt (754â715 BC)
* Niumateped, King of the Libyans (775â750 BC)
* Titaru, King of the Libyans (758â750 BC)
* Ker, King of the Libyans (750â745 BC)
* Manava, author of the Indian geometric text of Sulba Sutras. (b. 750 BC)
* Uzziah, King of Judah (791-740 BC)
* 759 BCâAlexander king of Corinth killed by his successor Telestes.
* 757 BCâBirth of Duke Zhuang of Zheng, China
